climbs.name: Wild Thing
climbs.fa: Marlene Ford, Jim Yoder, and Bill Robins; October 1998

content.description: Straightforward climbing down low brings you to a tricky finishing sequence on much smaller crimps.
content.protection: 5 bolts and chain anchor with quickclips.
content.location: First bolted line right of Wild Dogs

climbs.name: Wild Dogs
climbs.fa: unknown

content.description: A balancy climb on not super positive but secure holds. A nice change from the standard arete climbs.
content.location: Right of crack in the back on the recessed wall.

climbs.name: Well Preserved
climbs.fa: jim Yoder, Marlene Ford, Bill Robins, Sept. 1998

content.description:
A really fun route, with some hard to figure winding back and forth to find your way up the lower half. Seemed odd to me that Bill worked on this with Jim.

Be very careful at 1st and 2nd clip, ground fall potential.
content.protection: 6 bolts, and bolted anchor with quickclips.
content.location: on the arete right of the Crack in the back, with the clips on the left side as you climb.

climbs.name: Used Sex Toys
climbs.fa: unknown

content.description:
Climb a surprisingly clean crack using mostly thin hands and tips, with ample feet throughout. The crack widens as you go up and there's a spot of offwidth towards the top. There's also a few crimps in places, if you're so inclined. Mantle onto the ledge and finish right, at the chains of

Falsies

.

It wouldn't be Vantage without a few loose flakes, so be careful what you pull on; some will eventually rip off.

I used gear up to BD #3, but you could maybe slot as big as #4. And take a couple #2's, unless you want to run it out.

It's a 5.8 if you use face holds, but 5.9 if you stick to jamming the crack.
content.protection: Gear to 3.5" (maybe leave the small nuts behind). Shares chain anchor with Falsies.
content.location:
Thin hands + finger crack immediately to the left of the bolted

Falsies

route.

climbs.name: Sperm Burps
climbs.fa: Bill Robins and Paul Certa; October 1998

content.description: A hand to OW crack on the far right end the Kotick Memorial Wall.
content.protection:
Gear to 4"

Bolted Anchor reached by traversing left once you're at the top.
content.location: Far right of the wall past the alcove of routes. Go over a few cracks (right of the obvious wide crack "tasty evidence") to a hand to OW crack.

climbs.name: Silhouettes
climbs.fa: John Eminger, John Kittel, and Gary Koch; October 1990

content.description: Climbing the arête all the way up, crux is just below the anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts and chain anchor with quickclips.
content.location: Start of top a huge boulder.

climbs.name: Rod of God
climbs.fa: Kurt Schmierer, Bob Buckley, Kevin Kurtz, and Jeff Ball; February 1989

content.description: Climb up on to a pedestal at the base of a free standing pillar. Climb up on positive incuts and good feet topping out on the pillar.
content.location: Obvious free standing pillar at the start of the wall.

climbs.name: The Oral Office
climbs.fa: Bill Robins and Paul Certa; October 1998

content.description:
Start climbing a thin hand/hand crack with tons of face holds. Face climb and jam up this thing. Crux is the last few moves which can be jammed or face climbed or a combination.

After about 25 feet of this you end on a ledge with a bolted chain anchor.
content.location:
Far side of the wall. There is a little alcove and a ledge the routes start on the ledge. "Oral Office" is one right of the middle one. It is left of a wide crack - "Gargling Sperm"

Bolted Anchor shared by all routes in this alcove.

climbs.name: Old Friends
climbs.fa: John Eminger and Gina Eminger; May 1993

content.description: Climb loose hand-fist crack.
content.location: Right of Wild Dogs. Which is an alcove after crack in the back, but before you drop down to where "oral office" is.

climbs.name: Monica's Dress
climbs.fa: Jim Yoder and Eric Snyder; September 1998

content.description: Climb to the right of the first two bolts, use the adjacent pillar to stem.  Head back to the arête and jug haul the rest of the way up.
content.location: First set of bolts after you pass through the miny tunnel.

climbs.name: Kittitas Bong Squad
climbs.fa: Kevin Kurtz, Kramer Canup, Oren Cowlishaw

content.description: An ode to the recently buffed tag on the Palouse to Cascades trail spanning over I-90. This route is still exfoliating in places but will clean up with more traffic (maybe). ??
content.location: Arete to crack/dihedral finish

climbs.name: Heart Beat
climbs.fa: Jim Yoder, Bill Robins, and Dale Fleshman; September 1998

content.description:
Start by climbing up onto a pedastal, clip a bolt and continue climbing up on jugs and good incuts. Once at the lip a mantel (crux) gains the ledge. Note, you can go way left to make it easier but that takes away from the route IMO. The crux is very well protected.

Plan to rap off or belay this one from above, or you'll be dealing with some serious rope scrapage.
content.location: The farthest right bolted line on the Kotick Wall.

climbs.name: Gargling Sperm
climbs.fa: Bill Robins and Paul Certa; October 1998

content.description: Climb up the wide crack. There are so many face holds its pretty much a face climb the whole way. Though some will do an OW move or two at the top.
content.protection:
Gear from 2 or 3"-6"

Bolted Chain anchor on the ledge at the top.
content.location: Wide crack on the far side of the wall in the alcove of routes.

climbs.name: Falsies
climbs.fa: Kevin Pogue and Paul Parker; February 2003

content.description: Climb the well protected arete using solid incuts and flat edges.
content.location: Bolted line left of crack in the back.

climbs.name: Draft Dodging, Pot Smokin',  Rasperry Intern Fudge Swirl
climbs.fa: Jim Yoder, Dale Fleshman, and Bill Robins; September 1998

content.description: Face climb up the thin crack with a jam or two. Clipping two pins and a bolt before gaining a ledge with a chain anchor.
content.protection:
Gear to 1"

2 pins and one bolt at the top.
content.location:
Far side of the kotick wall.

Left/center crack route with obvious pins.

climbs.name: Dale and Jim's Excellent Adventure
climbs.fa: Jim Yoder and Dale Fleshman; September 1998

content.description:
Climb the thin crack which starts on a flake then face climb on incuts/crimps and throw the occasional jam.

Some holds are loose and some rock is hollow.
content.location:
Left most in the alcove at the far side of the wall.

Look for the flake at the start.

climbs.name: Crack in the Back
climbs.fa: Jim Yoder and Bill Robins; September 1998

content.description:
Climb the hand crack which widens to 4 Camalot size. Plenty of jugs as well.

Higher up you can stem off the pillar behind you.

The ledge at the top has chains.
content.protection:
Gear to 4"'

Most people will want multiple fist sized pieces. (3 camalot)

Chains on top.
content.location: After "Rod of God" in a little alcove hosting a few routes.

climbs.name: Chimney Divine
climbs.fa: Leland Windham, Frank Bush; 5/2010

content.description:
Chimney behind rod of god.

Can be climbed with either chimney or face technique.
content.location: Behind rod of god.

climbs.name: Carnage in the Temple of the Damned
climbs.fa: Leland Windham and Bob Tabscott; February 1991

content.description: A fun, short climb with good movement on the face of a pillar.
content.location: Closest route to the Near Trail gully

climbs.name: A Step Before Winter Walking
climbs.fa: Leland Windham and Nicole Flessner; October 2004

content.description: Pretty fun route with pretty good holds, but a little thin near the top.
content.location: This route is on the far right of Kotick Memorial Wall and is about 200 feet past the right-most rote.

climbs.name: A Game of Inches
climbs.fa: Mike Brown, Scott Schaff, Marlene Ford, Jim Yoder

content.description: Fun balancey climb to the right of Silhouettes. Pull on great side pulls all the way to the top.
content.location: To the right of Silhouettes on the next pillar.
